movie.title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story
movie.plot: A rogue band of resistance fighters unite for a mission to steal the Death Star plans and bring a new hope to the galaxy.
movie.actors: Felicity Jones, Diego Luna, Alan Tudyk, Donnie Yen
movie.writer: Chris Weitz (screenplay), Tony Gilroy (screenplay), John Knoll (story by), Gary Whitta (story by), George Lucas (based on characters created by)

movie.title: Split
movie.plot: Though Kevin has evidenced 23 personalities to his trusted psychiatrist, Dr. Fletcher, there remains one still submerged who is set to materialize and dominate all the others. Compelled to abduct three teenage girls led by the willful, observant Casey, Kevin reaches a war for survival among all of those contained within him — as well as everyone around him — as the walls between his compartments shatter apart.
movie.actors: James McAvoy, Anya Taylor-Joy, Betty Buckley, Haley Lu Richardson
movie.writer: M. Night Shyamalan

movie.title: Sing
movie.plot: A koala named Buster recruits his best friend to help him drum up business for his theater by hosting a singing competition.
movie.actors: Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon, Seth MacFarlane, Scarlett Johansson
movie.writer: Garth Jennings

movie.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them
movie.plot: In 1926, Newt Scamander arrives at the Magical Congress of the United States of America with a magically expanded briefcase, which houses a number of dangerous creatures and their habitats. When the creatures escape from the briefcase, it sends the American wizarding authorities after Newt, and threatens to strain even further the state of magical and non-magical relations.
movie.actors: Eddie Redmayne, Sam Redford, Scott Goldman, Tim Bentinck
movie.writer: J.K. Rowling

movie.title: The Lost City of Z
movie.plot: A true-life drama, centering on British explorer Col. Percival Fawcett, who disappeared while searching for a mysterious city in the Amazon in the 1920s.
movie.actors: Charlie Hunnam, Sienna Miller, Tom Holland, Robert Pattinson
movie.writer: James Gray (written for the screen by), David Grann (based on the book "The Lost City of Z: A Tale of Deadly Obsession in the Amazon" by)

movie.title: Moana
movie.plot: In Ancient Polynesia, when a terrible curse incurred by Maui reaches an impetuous Chieftain's daughter's island, she answers the Ocean's call to seek out the demigod to set things right.
movie.actors: Auli'i Cravalho, Dwayne Johnson, Rachel House, Temuera Morrison
movie.director: Ron Clements, Don Hall, John Musker, Chris Williams
movie.writer: Jared Bush (screenplay), Ron Clements (story by), John Musker (story by), Chris Williams (story by), Don Hall (story by), Pamela Ribon (story by), Aaron Kandell (story by), Jordan Kandell (story by)

movie.title: La La Land
movie.plot: Mia, an aspiring actress, serves lattes to movie stars in between auditions and Sebastian, a jazz musician, scrapes by playing cocktail party gigs in dingy bars, but as success mounts they are faced with decisions that begin to fray the fragile fabric of their love affair, and the dreams they worked so hard to maintain in each other threaten to rip them apart.
movie.actors: Ryan Gosling, Emma Stone, Amiée Conn, Terry Walters
movie.writer: Damien Chazelle

movie.title: The Void
movie.plot: In the middle of a routine patrol, officer Daniel Carter happens upon a blood-soaked figure limping down a deserted stretch of road. He rushes the young man to a nearby rural hospital staffed by a skeleton crew, only to discover that patients and personnel are transforming into something inhuman. As the horror intensifies, Carter leads the other survivors on a hellish voyage into the subterranean depths of the hospital in a desperate bid to end the nightmare before it's too late.
movie.actors: Aaron Poole, Kenneth Welsh, Daniel Fathers, Kathleen Munroe
movie.writer: Jeremy Gillespie, Steven Kostanski

movie.title: Lion
movie.plot: A five-year-old Indian boy gets lost on the streets of Calcutta, thousands of kilometers from home. He survives many challenges before being adopted by a couple in Australia; 25 years later, he sets out to find his lost family.
movie.actors: Sunny Pawar, Abhishek Bharate, Priyanka Bose, Khushi Solanki
movie.writer: Saroo Brierley (adapted from the book "A Long Way Home" by), Luke Davies (screenplay)

movie.title: Passengers
movie.plot: A spacecraft traveling to a distant colony planet and transporting thousands of people has a malfunction in its sleep chambers. As a result, two passengers are awakened 90 years early.
movie.actors: Jennifer Lawrence, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Laurence Fishburne
movie.writer: Jon Spaihts

movie.title: Hacksaw Ridge
movie.plot: WWII American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, who served during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people and becomes the first Conscientious Objector in American history to win the Congressional Medal of Honor.
movie.actors: Andrew Garfield, Richard Pyros, Jacob Warner, Milo Gibson
movie.writer: Robert Schenkkan (screenplay), Andrew Knight (screenplay)

movie.title: Trolls
movie.plot: Lovable and friendly, the trolls love to play around. But one day, a mysterious giant shows up to end the party. Poppy, the optimistic leader of the Trolls, and her polar opposite, Branch, must embark on an adventure that takes them far beyond the only world they’ve ever known.
movie.actors: Anna Kendrick, Justin Timberlake, Zooey Deschanel, Christopher Mintz-Plasse
movie.writer: Jonathan Aibel (screenplay), Glenn Berger (screenplay), Erica Rivinoja (story by), Thomas Dam (based on the Good Luck Trolls created by)

movie.title: The Promise
movie.plot: Set during the last days of the Ottoman Empire, The Promise follows a love triangle between Michael, a brilliant medical student, the beautiful and sophisticated artist Ana, and Chris - a renowned American journalist based in Paris.
movie.actors: Christian Bale, Oscar Isaac, Shohreh Aghdashloo, Angela Sarafyan
movie.writer: Terry George, Robin Swicord

movie.title: Hidden Figures
movie.plot: The untold story of Katherine G. Johnson, Dorothy Vaughan and Mary Jackson – brilliant African-American women working at NASA and serving as the brains behind one of the greatest operations in history – the launch of astronaut John Glenn into orbit. The visionary trio crossed all gender and race lines to inspire generations to dream big.
movie.actors: Taraji P. Henson, Octavia Spencer, Janelle Monáe, Kevin Costner
movie.writer: Allison Schroeder (screenplay), Theodore Melfi (screenplay), Margot Lee Shetterly (based on the book by)

movie.title: Boyka: Undisputed IV
movie.plot: In the fourth installment of the fighting franchise, Boyka is shooting for the big leagues when an accidental death in the ring makes him question everything he stands for. When he finds out the wife of the man he accidentally killed is in trouble, Boyka offers to fight in a series of impossible battles to free her from a life of servitude
movie.actors: Scott Adkins, Teodora Duhovnikova, Alon Aboutboul, Julian Vergov
movie.writer: Boaz Davidson (story), David N. White

movie.title: Arrival

movie.writer: Eric Heisserer (screenplay), Ted Chiang (based on the story "Story of Your Life" written by)

movie.title: War Dogs

movie.title: Mine

movie.writer: Fabio Guaglione (screenplay), Fabio Resinaro (screenplay)

movie.title: The Founder
movie.plot: The true story of how Ray Kroc, a salesman from Illinois, met Mac and Dick McDonald, who were running a burger operation in 1950s Southern California. Kroc was impressed by the brothers’ speedy system of making the food and saw franchise potential. He maneuvered himself into a position to be able to pull the company from the brothers and create a billion-dollar empire.

movie.writer: Robert D. Siegel

movie.title: Suicide Squad

movie.title: Your Name.
movie.plot: High schoolers Mitsuha and Taki are complete strangers living separate lives. But one night, they suddenly switch places. Mitsuha wakes up in Taki’s body, and he in hers. This bizarre occurrence continues to happen randomly, and the two must adjust their lives around each other.

movie.writer: Makoto Shinkai (based on his novel), Makoto Shinkai (screenplay), Clark Cheng (english script)

movie.title: Why Him?
movie.plot: Ned, an overprotective dad, visits his daughter at Stanford where he meets his biggest nightmare: her well-meaning but socially awkward Silicon Valley billionaire boyfriend, Laird. movie.title: The Bad Batch

movie.title: Brimstone

movie.title: Deadpool
movie.plot: Based upon Marvel Comics’ most unconventional anti-hero, DEADPOOL tells the origin story of former Special Forces operative turned mercenary Wade Wilson, who after being subjected to a rogue experiment that leaves him with accelerated healing powers, adopts the alter ego Deadpool. Armed with his new abilities and a dark, twisted sense of humor, Deadpool hunts down the man who nearly destroyed his life.
movie.actors: Ryan Reynolds, Karan Soni, Ed Skrein, Michael Benyaer
movie.writer: Rhett Reese, Paul Wernick

movie.title: The BFG
movie.plot: The BFG is no ordinary bone-crunching giant. He is far too nice and jumbly. It's lucky for Sophie that he is. Had she been carried off in the middle of the night by the Bloodbottler, or any of the other giants—rather than the BFG—she would have soon become breakfast. When Sophie hears that the giants are flush-bunking off to England to swollomp a few nice little chiddlers, she decides she must stop them once and for all. And the BFG is going to help her!
movie.actors: Mark Rylance, Ruby Barnhill, Penelope Wilton, Jemaine Clement
movie.writer: Melissa Mathison (screenplay), Roald Dahl (book)

movie.title: Raw
movie.plot: In Justine’s family everyone is a vet and a vegetarian. At 16, she’s a gifted teen ready to take on her first year in vet school, where her older sister also studies. There, she gets no time to settle: hazing starts right away. Justine is forced to eat raw meat for the first time in her life. Unexpected consequences emerge as her true self begins to form.

movie.writer: Julia Ducournau (dialogue), Julia Ducournau (screenplay)

movie.writer: Marc Haimes (screenplay), Chris Butler (screenplay), Shannon Tindle (story by), Marc Haimes (story by)

movie.title: The Girl on the Train

Octavia Spencer plays Roberta, Frank and Mary's landlady and best friend. Jenny Slate is Mary's teacher, Bonnie, a young woman whose concern for her student develops into a connection with her uncle as well.
